answers.answer: I'm glad you have an appt for him tomorrow.  Unfortunately, we can make all the guesses in the world, but it doesn't mean a thing.  Only a doctor will be able to order the correct tests to see what's going on with him.Please update if you can.  It would sure be interesting to hear what the doctor said.
Thankyou i should have also said that he is on 3 different medications he takes respiridol, metadate, and tenex i wonder if any of those could mess with his sugar levels i will update tomorrow

question: Hi well last night i was checking my sugar levels and my 5 year old was like do me mommy so i fugred sure why not he is always taking my meter and lancet and trying to play with it and i figured well if i poke him he will see it hurts and maybe he won't touch it anymore so i checked it and it was 426 i wanted to check it again but he just would not let me do it and then today he did let me check it again and it was 296 and then i checked it an hour later and it was 158 i am not sure what normal sugar levels for a child are suppose to be at and any help would be great and also when i checked it and it was 426 it had been 30 mins since he ate and he ate half of a piece of vegetarian pizza and then when it was 296 it was an hour after he ate a small bowl of potatoe chips.  I am just worried i don't want him to develop diabetes i had gestational diabetes when i was pregnant with him can that make him at higher risk for developing it and i now have diabetes i had it during my pregnancy with my 2 year old and my 6 month old daughter also and now i still have it i guess it didn't go away like it did the other times. My son has an appt tomorrow at 10 but any insight till then would really make me feel better i just sat there and cried when i took his reading. And then  i laughed because he said mommy don't cry and then he asked for a cupcake lol i gave him a peach instead .
title: 5 year old sugar levels
